availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip H. Snyder (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Snyder. Married to Mary E. Yeager Snyder in Shelby County, Kentucky, on February 4, 1857. Father of Wilton Snyder, Mary Snyder, Nancy E. Snyder, Florence P. Snyder, and Zula M. Snyder. Resident of Oldham County in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860. Farmer in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 148B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 357.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 896.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 170B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Middletown, p. 384A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Oldham County, KY, July 1863.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 4562.
